snippet: The cabinet’s 24 members span the political spectrum, including Hezbollah, the militant Shiite organization, and its Western-backed foes.
abstract: Lebanese Prime Min Tammam Salam announces formation of 24-member cabinet representing many of country's divergent political factions.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Ben Hubbard from Kilis, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: The cabinet’s 24 members span the political spectrum, including Hezbollah, the militant Shiite organization, and its Western-backed foes.

headline.main: Lebanon Forms a Cabinet After 11 Months of Deadlock
headline.print_headline: Lebanon Forms a Cabinet After 11 Months of Deadlock

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
